original: avalokiteśvarāṣṭakastotram
analyzed: avalokiteśvara aṣṭaka stotram
translated: The Hymn to the Eight Avalokiteshvaras

original: om namo'valokiteśvarāya
analyzed: om namaḥ uvalokiteśvarāya
translated: Om, homage to Avalokiteshvara

original: stutvā guṇairanupamairanubindupātraṃ stotraṃ mayā kṛtamidaṃ jaḍavāliśena /
analyzed: stutvā guṇaiḥ anupamaiḥ anu bindu pātram stotram mayā kṛtam idam jaḍa vāliśena
translated: Having praised with incomparable qualities, I, a dull and foolish one, have composed this hymn in a water pot.

original: lokeśvaraṃ guṇanidhiṃ guṇasāgaraṃ ca nityaṃ namāmi śirasāñjalisaṃpuṭena // //
analyzed: loka īśvaram guṇa nidhim guṇa sāgaram ca nityam namāmi śirasā añjali saṃpuṭena
translated: I constantly bow my head with folded palms to Lokeshvara, the treasure of virtues and the ocean of virtues.

original: prāṇeṣu yan sravati yena rasāmbupārān kṣuttṛṣṇaduḥkhaparipīḍitasarvasattvān /
analyzed: prāṇeṣu yan sravati yena rasa ambu pārān kṣudh tṛṣṇā duḥkha paripīḍita sarva sattvān
translated: By which the essence flows in the life-breaths, all beings afflicted by hunger, thirst and suffering,

original: evaṃvidhaṃ jagadidaṃ paripālanāya tasmai namo'stu satataṃ hi yathārthanāmne // //
analyzed: evaṃvidham jagat idam paripālanāya tasmai namaḥ astu satatam hi yathārtha nāmne
translated: For the protection of this world in such a way, homage to him, whose name is truly meaningful.

original: satkuṅkumāttamaruṇāṅkasamānavarṇaṃ dvātriṃśalakṣaṇavibhūṣitagātraśobham /
analyzed: sat kuṅkuma āttam aruṇa aṅka samāna varṇam dvātriṃśa lakṣaṇa vibhūṣita gātra śobham
translated: Having a color similar to the best red saffron, the beauty of the body adorned with thirty-two auspicious marks,

original: sarveṣu yasya karuṇāmayavatsalatvaṃ tasmai namāmi bhavate karuṇāmayāya // //
analyzed: sarveṣu yasya karuṇā āmaya vatsala tvam tasmai namāmi bhavate karuṇā āmayāya
translated: In all of whom there is compassion and affection, I bow to you, O Compassionate One.

original: saṃsārasāgaramahālayanāśadakṣa ekastvameva śaraṇaṃ bhuvi naikanātha /
analyzed: saṃsāra sāgara mahā ālaya nāśa dakṣaḥ ekaḥ tvam eva śaraṇam bhuvi nā ekanātha
translated: The only one capable of destroying the great abode of the ocean of worldly existence, you alone are the refuge on earth, O Lord of many,

original: kenāpi tvadguṇagaṇā gaṇane na śakyāstaṃ lokanāthamavalokitanāmasaṃjñam // //
analyzed: kena api tvad guṇa gaṇāḥ gaṇane na śakyāḥ tam lokanātham avalokita nāma saṃjñam
translated: By no one are your multitudes of virtues capable of being counted, that Lord of the world, known by the name Avalokita.

original: nānāvidhābharaṇamaṇḍitadivyarupaṃ bālendulagnajaṭabhūṣitalokanātham /
analyzed: nānāvidha ābharaṇa maṇḍita divya rupam bāla indu lagna jaṭa bhūṣita lokanātham
translated: Adorned with various ornaments, having a divine form, with matted locks on the head resembling the crescent moon, the Lord of the world,

original: vāme ca maṇḍaladharaṃ varadaṃ ca savye tvāṃ lokanātha śaraṇaṃ pravrajāmi nityam // //
analyzed: vāme ca maṇḍala dharam vara dam ca savye tvām lokanātha śaraṇam pravrajāmi nityam
translated: Holding a discus in the left hand and granting boons with the right hand, I always take refuge in you, O Lord of the world.

original: brahmādibhiḥ parivṛtaṃ surasiddhasaṃghairgandharvakinnaramahoraganāgayakṣaiḥ /
analyzed: brahma ādibhiḥ parivṛtam sura siddha saṃghaiḥ gandharva kinnara mahā uraga nāga yakṣaiḥ
translated: Surrounded by Brahma and others, by groups of gods and siddhas, by gandharvas, kinnaras, mahoragas, nagas and yakshas,

original: nāthasya yasya bhavataścaraṇāmbujaṃ ca taṃ lokanāthacaraṇaṃ śaraṇaṃ vrajāmi // //
analyzed: nāthasya yasya bhavataḥ caraṇa ambujam ca tam lokanātha caraṇam śaraṇam vrajāmi  /
translated: I go for refuge to the feet of Lord Lokanatha, whose lotus feet are served by these beings.

original: bhūtaiḥ piśācagaruḍoragarākṣasībhiḥ kumbhāṇḍapūtanamahallakarājarājaiḥ /
analyzed: bhūtaiḥ piśāca garuḍa uraga rākṣasībhiḥ kumbhāṇḍa pūtana mahallaka rājarājaiḥ
translated: By ghosts, pisacas, garudas, serpents, rakshasas, kumbhandas, putanas, mahallaras, kings and kings of kings,

original: vaiśvānarāsuraśataiḥ parivārabhūtaṃ taṃ lokanāthacaraṇaṃ śaraṇaṃ gato'smi // //
analyzed: vaiśvānara asura śataiḥ parivāra bhūtam tam lokanātha caraṇam śaraṇam gataḥ asmi  /
translated: Surrounded by hundreds of Vaishvanara asuras, I go for refuge to the feet of Lord Lokanatha.

original: abdhirdivākarakarairnahi śoṣameti tadvatkavīśvaraśatairguṇasāgaraste /
analyzed: abdhiḥ divākara karaiḥ na hi śoṣam eti tadvat kavi īśvara śataiḥ guṇa sāgaraḥ te
translated: Just as the ocean is not dried up by the rays of the sun, in the same way, O Lord of poets, the ocean of your virtues is not diminished by hundreds of great poets.

original: lokeśvara prathitakīrtinidhānabhūto na kṣīyate guṇanidhirguṇasāgarasya // //
analyzed: loka īśvara prathita kīrti nidhāna bhūtaḥ na kṣīyate guṇa nidhiḥ guṇa sāgarasya
translated: O Lord of the world, the treasure of fame, the abode of virtues, the ocean of virtues is not diminished.

original: ślokāṣṭakaṃ pratidinaṃ khalu ye paṭhanti te prāpnuvanti sahasā dhanaputramokṣān /
analyzed: śloka aṣṭakam pratidinam khalu ye paṭhanti te prāpnuvanti sahasā dhana putra mokṣān
translated: Those who recite this set of eight verses every day, they suddenly attain wealth, children and liberation.

original: kuṣṭhādiroganikaraṃ kṣamatāṃ prayāti vandāmahe ca nitarāṃ tava pādayugme // //
analyzed: kuṣṭha ādi roga nikaram kṣamatām prayāti vandāmahe ca nitarām tava pāda yugme  /
translated: May the multitude of diseases such as leprosy be destroyed. We bow down to your two feet.

original: śrī āryāvalokiteśvarasya ślokāṣṭakaṃ samāptam /
analyzed: śrī ārya avalokiteśvarasya śloka aṣṭakam samāptam
translated: The eight verses of the noble Avalokiteshvara are complete.
